title: Drawing, "George C. and Eleanor Hutton Rand Apartment: Vanity", July 12, 1934
medium: Graphite, red color pencil, and black ink on tracing paper
markings: Stamp in black ink, lower right: DONALD DESKEY/501 MADISON AVENUE/NEW YORK CITY
inscribed: Inscribed in graphite in stamp, lower right: 7891/F.S./RAND JOB/MIRROR-GOLD/METAL & WHITE/LACR., Olsson/DALMAR/D./7/12/34, 9/8/34, 1, S.H.K.; below stamp in graphite: VANITY.; above stamp in graphite, relating to perspective drawings: THIS UPRIGHT/SEPARATE; below: NO JOINTS IN METAL FRAME; below: LEATHER TOP & EDGE/SYCAMORE, CRYSTAL/MIRROR; below, left: WHITE/LEATHER/BRASS/MAT GOLD PLATED; right: LEATHER/WHITE LACQUER/BACK; dimensions, materials, instructions in graphite
description: Perspective, plan, and elevation drawings for vanity. Gold-plated mat brass trim/frame of narrow vanity, rounded front edge, squared back edges; mirrored-top of central unit. Pivoted section, with seam at front rounded edge. Outer surface of pivoted section in white leather, surface on opposite side in white lacquer. Pivoted section with two open shelves below in white sycamore.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "George C. and Eleanor Hutton Rand Apartment: Vanity", July 12, 1934.
July 12, 1934. Graphite, red color pencil, and black ink on tracing paper. Gift of Donald Deskey. 1975-11-821.
